one_reviews_text: This is a solid VR experience for the most part however a few jump cuts in the car are noticeable and can be annoying.
A great video with Eminem.

Some good cinematography in the b-roll sceenes. But it was full of jump cuts and repeated the car roof gimmick and combined it with jump cuts. Jump cuts are immersion breaking edits; If you're trying to create a VR experience might want to figure out your camera work and edits a little better.

Brilliant short vr documentary type of experience. The cinematography is fantastic as well as the locations shown, really makes you feel a little shiver coming over you. 
Vr needs more of this!!
I need more of this please.

I'm not heartbroken about this, as I'm not a fan. But, I work with a fan and wanted to show him. For some reason, this just spins and doesn't load the video or audio. To kill it, I have to open Task Manager and kill the multiple copies of it. All I get is a spinning white circle, that goes on and on. I don't know why it opens multiple copies of itself. Maybe that is why it doesn't run for me.

My general system specs are:
i7 9700K
32GB Ram
RTX 2080ti

This should run just about everything thrown at it. This is the first VR app that I have that doesn't work.

Maybe the devs have a solution. I'll let them have a crack at it.

***UPDATE*** - The Dev replied!... to the wrong name. Hey, thanks for being aware! I don't really care enough to bother "gathering" my PC info for this.
review_feedback: Hi MadInfamous, thanks for letting us know about this. Could you send an email to QA@felixandpaul.com explaining the issue and including your PC information? Our team will be able to help you from there. Thanks!

one_reviews_text: Why

The cinematography and stuff was really good, and it was also honestly interesting to listen to the conversation and watch the various scenes play out.

I just wish I was able to view these kinds of 360 videos in proper HD resolution, because the resolution is the one area where they just aren't at a high enough level right now to truly shine. But we'll get there in time.

Knowing the limitations of current-gen headsets though, this is really solid stuff.

It's free, so watch it and appreciate it for what it is.

For the main Part your sitting in a Vehicle (Limo/Hummer) just listening to an Interview with Eminem telling tales about Detroit and how its always going to be Home for him..  Your also taken through memory lane with scenes of what the places he performed in growing up and growing his talent are looking like now. 

The only issue is with some of the quality of the Video taken from outside the vehicle.

That being said for a free, exclusive, intirmate interview from the perspective most never get to experience, it's a must for Eminem Fan's & Music Fans alike.

review_title: Felix & Paul are the gold standard in VR
one_reviews_text: It just seems that with every new VR cinematic experience produced by Felix & Paul Studios, the quality just gets better & better. It really does feel like you're inches away from Marshall Matheres & Sway Calloway. This documentary is about 19 minutes long. Caleb Slain does a good job directing and just letting the focus be about Detroit. You see the grittiness in the people and in the city. I hope this is the future of filmmaking. I can't wait to see a real feature film in VR done in this style, hopefully, in the near future. Thank you Felix & Paul and thank you Oculus for bringing these free experiences to us. Makes me happy I chose Oculus over HTC Vive and if you're on Revive .... welcome to Oculus land.

review_title: I also came from a similar life
one_reviews_text: Grew up in the trailer park from a broken home.Dreamed of making it in music.Jesus got my attention on the eve of my destruction at the door of suicide.Weather you like or dislike eminem one thing you cant argue.The guy worked hard and still does put so much heart into the creative though possibly at time obscene work.My life changed and my soul was saved.Praise Jesus who is my Lord and Savior!

review_title: Only 20 Minutes But Worth Being Free
one_reviews_text: This is a great free interview in VR with Marshall himself in an Escalade and he discusses the hardships he faced as a rapper in Detroit. I'm from metro Detroit and does a good job of showing what most of the areas of Detroit look like (they don't show the outskirts of the city for good reason, a lot of the homes are literally shells of homes with boarded up windows).  My only other problem is the quality being a little poor but if they shot this in 2017 it's understandable because VR has come a long way in just the past year! But overall, it's a short but great film and I would recommend visiting Detroit sometime!

Imagine hanging out with eminem in the back of the car with your buddy - Thats what this is! It gives a very strong interpersonal feeling and makes you feel truly connected to what your perceiving with your eyes.
i do not understand some of the lingo here, i do not know this rapper, i have no soft spot for Detroit. and still...  i guess i have now:) professional piece of work - impressive!

It's a moving video for me, not only because I grow up in a similar city in China but also the special way the auther used to tell the story. Especially inside/outside cuts in it. Best documentry VR video so far, highly recommend.

Hi i am the world record freestyle rapper, 2341, I rapped for 100 hours continuous

Hi Marshall
@therealgodoftheunderground says hi

This is the coolest thing ever, I am so glad this opportunity was provided for me.

Whoever is reading this in the year 2341, what's good?

I guess I am the minority, being a big Eminem fab I was super hyped to try this out, unfortunetly it is very glitchy (transitions glitch out a lot) and the story/interview is just super boring. It was hard for me to sit through 20 min.

I did really like the idea behind this though.
Enjoyed the ride with eminem in the car, hope soon i can ride with Jenifer Lopez and listen her stories :)))
It's good if you like Eminem, Rap/Hip hop or both. other than that though, there is not much more to see.
Even if you don't like Eminem and/or Hip Hop this is a must see. Immersive, emotional.
Great interview and perfect 3D depth.
Perfect use of 360 video.

Maybe it helps if you actually know who these dudes are lol.

Interesting short video in good 360 quality. I love music documentary and the fact this comes in VR makes it more interesting to me. Nice feel to sit in the Limo with Em and Sway Calloway talking about Detroit and his career. Must see!
